items.content_html:
Description

add {{AvailableInWorkers}} macros to File and FileList related pages

remove incorrect usage of {{ReadOnlyInline}} macros of FileList.item() method in FileList interface summary

cleanup File interface summary to remove inherits propertys and methods

add {{optional_inline}} macros for type param and lastModified param of File() constructor, also adding content for possible endings param, also rename its first and second param to fileBits and fileName to better reflect its meaning

fix some incorrect usage of {{APIRef("File API")}} macros in File() constructor and File.lastModified property

reference to spec https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: some fix of `File` and `FileList` interface

items.content_html:
Description

add {{AvailableInWorkers}} macros to Blob related pages

mark Blob() constructor blobParts param as {{optional_inline}}, also rename from array to blobParts to better reflect its meaning

also remove Blob() constructor endings param {{non-standard_inline}} macros since this feature can be found in standard

also some other style fix

see spec https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: some fix of `Blob` interface

items.content_html:
Description

Introduce a new table mirroring an existing table in the W3C spec that explains the expected return values for the getTargetRanges method. Notably, this table highlights that for editing hosts that are not contenteditable, the expected return value for this method is an empty array (which is not currently clear anywhere except the W3C docs).

Motivation

When experimenting with beforeinput and getTargetRanges, I was confused to find that the result seemed to always be an empty array (even when I thought I was configuring everything correctly). The existing docs didn't explain that, per the W3C spec, returning an empty array is the expected behavior in certain scenarios.

Additional details

Matching W3C spec: https://w3c.github.io/input-events/#interface-InputEvent-Methods
items.title: Extend the getTargetRanges method documentation

items.title: Tweaks to SPC documentation following extensive edits

items.content_html:
Description

Currently, the color-scheme CSS property has a single code example how to set this property. However, there are no practical examples how to use this property with other properties.

The new example uses both prefers-color-scheme media query and light-dark() color function.
items.title: Add an example to `color-scheme` CSS property

items.content_html:
Description

Add information about the space key and show how to handle the space key press in the example.

Motivation

It can be confusing how to check for space key press as it was discussed in issue #30562 This PR ads information about that and shows how to handle the key press in the example for clarification.

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #30562
items.title: Add information about the space key

items.content_html:
• fixes #30675

The new contrast between button and background is 3.49:1
items.title: fix(css): update good contrast example

items.content_html:
Part of openwebdocs/project#185

Move the XML-related guide under Web/XML.
items.title: Move guide under Web/XML

items.content_html:
Description

I added the following links to the bottom of the HTMLElement meter page:

  • {{cssxref("::-webkit-meter-bar")}}
  • {{cssxref("::-webkit-meter-inner-element") }}
  • {{cssxref("::-webkit-meter-even-less-good-value")}}
  • {{cssxref("::-webkit-meter-optimum-value")}}
  • {{cssxref("::-webkit-meter-suboptimum-value")}}

Motivation

The HTMLElement progress page has links for its CSS-related pseudo-elements, but the meter page lacks them. Therefore, I added these links for better completeness and user navigation.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: (HTML) Add `-webkit` prefixed props to `<meter>` page

items.content_html:
Aligns touchcancel and pointercancel examples.
Adds a further example from iPhone 11 with 5 maxtouchpoints.
Reference the cancel events in the corresponding up events.

Description

Motivation

I was quite surprised to have missing touchup events with 6 fingers on an iphone.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Align touchcancel and pointercancel examples

items.content_html: As used in the example below, the method name in the description is getOffsetReferenceSpace() and not referenceOffsetReferenceSpace(). Fixing the broken link.
items.title: Rename requesttOffsetReferenceSpace() to getOffsetReferenceSpace()

items.content_html:
These articles are non-existent and, as they have no internal redirects, likely were never written.

This page would need a severe rework, but it is outside the scope of this PR.
items.title: Remove links to non-existent articles

items.content_html:
• Removed the Permissions section that is irrelevant nowadays
  • Removed mention of the name of the dictionary MediaStreamError (as well as the non-existent list of errors)
items.title: Slightly improve outdated Navigator.getUserMedia()

items.content_html: There is no glossary entry for symbol, but we have a page about it in JS.
items.title: Fix link to Symbol

items.content_html:
Similar to #30681 but on Window.

We document events on their EventTarget. Although some may bubble, we only document them once.

This PR removes events from the Window event list that are not targetting it. (They can only reach it via the bubbling mechanism).

This was an oddity dating from before we decided how to deal with events in 2021.
items.title: Removed events that do not target Window from the list

items.content_html:
We document events on their EventTarget. Although some may bubble, we only document them once.

This PR removes events from the Document event list that are not targetting it. (They can only reach it – and Window after it – via the bubbling mechanism).

This was an oddity dating from before we decided how to deal with events in 2021.
items.title: Removed events that do not target Document from the list

items.content_html:
We already did this for the drag event in #30615.

Applying the same resolution to the other drag-and-drop events.
items.title: Fix broken links for drag-and-drop events

items.content_html: Fixes #30669 by adding the missing parameter.
items.title: Add second parameter of XSLTProcessr.transformToFragment()
